results.title: Olympics: the eternal torch
results.creator_credit: Dan Rose, Associated Press, Oxford Films and Sam Summerlin
results.brief_description: Uses footage dating back to 1896 and highlights taken from each Olympiad since, to trace American participation in the games. Shows the pageantry and traditions that make up this international institution.

results.title: Olympic wrestling: an introduction
results.brief_description: Part one: Provides a history of wrestling, its suitability for schools, and a description of training programmmes for developing skills. Part two: Explains the rules of a match, the roles of the officials and the scoring system. No other credits available.

results.title: Olympic torch relay: living the dream
results.creator_credit: Black Magic Media, SOCOG, Erica Powell, Trevor Seaman, Michael McCarthy and Paul Mullan
results.brief_description: On May 10, 2000 in Olympia, Greece, the Olympic Flame burst into life for the Sydney 2000 Olympics. This video follows the path of the torch from Greece to Guam, where it began a two week journey through 13 Pacific Island countries of Oceania. Then, onto its 100 day, 27,000 km tour of Australia, beginning with the arrival at Connellan Airport at Yulara, Northern Territory on 8 June, 2000. The relay concluded with the lighting of the cauldron at the Sydney Olympic Games Opening Ceremony, 15 September 2000. The purpose of the torch relay was to spread the spirit of the Olympic Games to as many Australians as possible and as a commemorative tribute, the names of each of the 11,000 Torchbearers and 2,500 escort runners are listed at the end of the video.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Black Magic Media, SOCOG, Erica Powell, Trevor Seaman, Michael McCarthy and Paul Mullan

results.title: Olympic swimmers
results.creator_credit: Jacques Bobet, ONF | NFB and Gilles Carle
results.brief_description: Shows Canada’s top swimmers in training for the 1964 Olympic Games. In gymnasium and pool, under the critical eye of coach Ed Healy, they practise long hours to build strength and stamina. Their first test, shown in the film, was at the 1962 Canadian Swimming Championships, at which they carried off a number of trophies.

results.title: Olympic invitation
results.creator_credit: Herschells Films and Roy A. Driver
results.brief_description: The film that is said to have won the approval of the Olympic Games committee in Rome in 1949, and thus won for Melbourne the honour of being chosen as the site for the 1956 Olympic Games. Shows the attractions of Melbourne and in particular its advantages as a venue for the 1956 Olympic Games.

results.title: Olympic glory: the golden years
results.creator_credit: James Murray, Denis Phelan, Big Fights Olympic Library, Video Sports and Golden Years
results.brief_description: This series captures the golden years of Olympic competition where heroes like Dawn Fraser, Betty Cuthbert, Jesse Owens and Mark Spitz became legends of the Olympic spirit. Rare archival footage, narrated by Norman May, makes this a must for sports history lovers.

results.title: Olympic glory the golden years: Aussies and Kiwis in sport
results.creator_credit: James Murray, Golden Years and Denis Phelan
results.brief_description: Featuring remarkable achievements from athletes the like of; Betty Cithbert, Australai’s “Golden Girl” who was only 18 when she smashed the Olympic record for the 100m dashand took home three gold medals; Dawn Fraser, the first Olympic swimmer of either sex to win the same event three times; Raelene Boyle, the super sprinter twice runner-up in the 200m track event, beaten by world record wins each time,; and Jack Lovelock who scored an incredible victory in one of the most hotly contested 1500m finals in Olympic history. Porduction based on the Big Fights Olympic library.

results.title: Olympic Games, Melbourne, Australia, 1956
results.brief_description: The 1956 Olympics warranted the Straford Brothers using their cherished stock of coloured film to capture this unique event. Original footage of the Athletics field (notably pole vaulting), swimming and diving events in the pool have been compiled by Frank years later with additional video content and a voiceover. Despite shooting some of this additional footage on his living room floor (inadvertantly including a glimpse of shagpile carpet) and such ‘special effects’ as a whiteboard marker illustrating points on a map, the documentary has a lot of interesting detail about the event; about their personal experience of it and the novelty of seeing OB Television crews in action.

results.title: Olympic Games, 1960, Rome = La Grande olimpiade
results.creator_credit: Cineriz, Realiegato dall'Institute Nationale and Romolo Marcellini
results.brief_description: After the arrival of the Olympic torch from Greece, and a short history of the Games, Pope John welcomes the athletes and the Games are opened in an impressive ceremony. Interspersed between the various events are glimpses of the tourists and competitors. Includes Herb Elliott’s world record and olympic record, Dawn Fraser’s world record and Australia winning the cross-country riding event. The final highlights are the great marathon and the closing ceremony.
